answers.author: Jerry Giaimis
answers.text:
I've been in 3 communities all similar in size to Salisbury.  I keep the policy relatively simple - all media requests come to my office and if necessary I put them in touch with a department head who can provide more details if necessary.  I've never had to deal with much more than one daily newspaper, a few weeklies, and a small number of online publications.  There have been a few issues over time that garnered statewide/regional attention and the policy worked fine. The police department has their own policy but the only practical difference is to substitute Manager for Chief.
In a towns my size we never had the need to put the policy on paper and verbal reminders always worked.  You raise a good point and it may be worth penning a policy at some point.

author: Terence Arrington
text:
The City of Salisbury would like to implement a policy to ensure all requests from the media for interviews, information, or comments from Department Directors or staff is first approved by the Mayor.  
Does anyone have a similar policy in place?
Any advice regarding best practices is greatly appreciated.
Thanks in advance!
title: Media Release Policy
